description: Store data as JSON-like documents. Learn MongoDB basics.

slides.title: What is a Document Store? üìÑ
slides.content:
# MongoDB üçÉ

The most popular NoSQL database.

Data is stored in **BSON** (Binary JSON) documents.

Documents are grouped into **Collections** (similar to SQL Tables, but schema-less).

slides.title: The Document Structure
slides.content:
# JSON-like üì¶

````json
{
  "_id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "name": "Alice",
  "age": 30,
  "skills": ["JS", "Python"]
}
````

Supports nested objects and arrays.

slides.title: Inserting Data
slides.content:
# Create ‚ûï

`db.users.insertOne({ name: "Bob", age: 25 })`

`db.users.insertMany([{ name: "Carly" }, { name: "Dan" }])`

If the collection `users` doesn't exist, it's created automatically.

slides.title: Embedding vs Referencing
slides.content:
# Data Modeling üìê

- **Embedding:** Store address INSIDE the user document. Good for 1-to-few.
- **Referencing:** Store `address_id` in user doc. Good for 1-to-many/many-to-many.

slides.title: Format Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What binary format does MongoDB use to store documents?

slides.title: Updating Data
slides.content:
# Atomic Operators ‚öõÔ∏è

`db.users.updateOne({ name: "Bob" }, { $set: { age: 26 } })`

`$inc` (increment), `$push` (add to array), `$unset` (remove field).

slides.title: Indexing
slides.content:
# Speed ‚ö°

Like SQL, you can create indexes to speed up queries.

`db.users.createIndex({ name: 1 })`

Can also index fields inside nested objects or arrays.

slides.title: Aggregation Pipeline
slides.content:
# Advanced Queries üîß

Process data through stages.

1. `$match` (Filter)
2. `$group` (Aggregate)
3. `$sort`

Similar to SQL `GROUP BY` but more powerful.

slides.title: Replication
slides.content:
# High Availability üõ°Ô∏è

MongoDB uses **Replica Sets**.

A primary node receives writes, and multiple secondary nodes replicate data. If primary fails, a secondary is elected new primary.

slides.title: Sharding
slides.content:
# Big Data üåç

Distribute a single collection across multiple machines (Shards) based on a **Shard Key**.

Allows MongoDB to scale to Petabytes of data.

slides.title: Operator Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which operator is used to increment a numeric value in an existing document?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Document Stores üçÉ

JSON power.

- **BSON:** Binary storage.
- **Collections:** Groups of docs.
- **CRUD:** `insertOne`, `find`, `updateOne`.
- **Pipeline:** Aggregation.
